text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the model to outline that a legal mechanism is established through the state liability framework (under EU law, this typically refers to the *Francovich* doctrine or similar principles allowing individuals to claim damages when a Member State fails to implement EU law). The candidate answer focuses heavily on administrative complaints (CNPD, Commission infringement, Parliament petition) and direct judicial routes (preliminary reference to CJEU), but it completely fails to mention or outline the state liability framework as a specific legal mechanism available to the citizen for seeking redress or compensation due to the breach.", "criterion_id": "3c0c62a0-54b9-4909-8894-b7f2b199b40f"}
